result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas A Mayberry

Return to Sender, Insufficient Address, Unable to Forward.
Pre-trial conference on December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Defendant is not to discuss this case with the co defendants.

3:59 PM Defendant Nicholas A Mayberry in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Nicholas A Mayberry.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office, late add. Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
